DAZ Studio Legacy Class IDs

Previous to version 1.7.1.0 of DAZ Studio, class ids were 4-byte values represented by an unsigned long value that was assigned by DAZ. After version 1.7.1.0, class IDs were represented by GUIDs which can be generated by the developer on a local machine. DAZ no longer will assign legacy class IDs, all new classes should use GUIDs.

For classes that have already been assigned permanent class IDs by DAZ, no code changes should be necessary, but it will be necessary to recompile these plug-ins with the new SDK. The macro DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_FACTORY() is still provided for these classes and will automatically create a valid GUID from the existing class ID.

Classes that were previously assigned a legacy class ID can be converted to the new system and given a new GUID. However, this is not encouraged unless you know what you are doing. Classes which save data to the native file format must continue to use their legacy ID or data will not be correctly loaded from those files.

See also:
DZ_PLUGIN_CLASS_FACTORY()
